data: Salt Marsh at Francis Marion National Forest, South Carolina.
Salt Marsh at Francis Marion National Forest, South Carolina. (https://www.ncwetlands.org/learn/aboutncswetlands/types/)

Between each of these branches of Bushwick Creek were large areas of salt marshes and wetlands, covering all of todayâ€™s McCarren Park and the Greenpoint-Williamsburg Industrial Business Zone (IBZ) to the west of McCarren, and extending inland as far as Humboldt Street to the east and Hope Street to the south. A large

island, running roughly from North 13th Street to North 15th Street, and from Wythe Avenue to the eastern end of the McCarren track, separated the different branches of the Creek. Depending on the tides, large parts of the Creek system were variously exposed or covered with salt water. Together with nearby Newtown Creek, the waterway was part of the rich and fertile wetlands that had supported the indigenous populations in the area for centuries.
